Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining that Ms. Tajdini lost her U.S. permanent resident status and was not asylum shopping
Application_Facts: Ms. Tajdini left the U.S. in 1996
Did not maintain U.S. residency requirements
Fled Iran due to fear of persecution
Sought refugee protection in Canada despite prior U.S. permanent residency
Decision_Outcome: Board's decision was reasonable and supported by evidence
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board’s decision
Claimant_Status: Applicant for refugee status in Canada
Defendant_Behavior: Minister challenged the Board's decision on grounds of credibility and status determination errors
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard for reviewing credibility and factual findings
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review initiated by the Minister
Credibility_Assessment: The Board found Ms. Tajdini credible
Evidence_Used: Duration and location of residence (U.S. until 1996, Iran 1996–2004)
Lack of maintenance of U.S. residency ties
Application_Basis: Exclusion from refugee status based on prior permanent residency unless status was lost
Evidence_Assessed: Absence of evidence supporting asylum shopping
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Board’s favorable decision on refugee status
Governing_Rule: A person with permanent residency in another country is excluded from refugee status under Article 1E unless they have lost that status
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No evidence that Ms. Tajdini engaged in asylum shopping
Outcome: Board’s decision upheld; judicial review dismissed
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in Iran due to past experiences
Cause_Description: Ms. Tajdini fled Iran due to persecution fears and sought refugee protection in Canada, despite having U.S. permanent residency in 1994
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility and factual basis for abandonment of U.S. status
Evidence_Issues: No significant evidentiary issues identified; credibility accepted
Residency_Compliance: Found non-compliant with U.S. permanent residency maintenance requirements
Jurisdictional_Issue: Canada’s jurisdiction to assess refugee claim despite prior U.S. permanent residency
Evidence_Assessment: Findings supported by record; reasonable inference of abandonment
Decision_Rationale: Ms. Tajdini abandoned her U.S. permanent resident status by prolonged absence and failure to meet residency obligations; no asylum shopping established
Evidentiary_Issues: None found; evidence sufficient to support conclusion
